title: Bikini

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Clothing and accessories
emoji_net_data.definition: A two-piece bikini, worn at the beach, pool, or on vacation at a tropical destination. Shown in a variety of colors and patterns across diff http://emojipedia.org/bikini/

bn:00110488a: Marked by or tending to arouse sexual desire or interest

bn:00094675v: To move through the water, without touching the bottom.
To move through the water, without touching the bottom; to propel oneself in water by natural means.

bn:00009013n: A swimsuit, bathing suit, swimming costume, bathing costume, swimming suit, swimmers, swimming togs, bathers, cossie, or swimming trunks for men, is an item of clothing designed to be worn by people engaging in a water-based activity or water sports, such as swimming, water polo, diving, surfing, water skiing, or during activities in the sun, such as sun bathing.
A tight-fitting garment worn for swimming, especially the one piece garment worn by women and girls; a swimsuit.
Tight fitting garment worn for swimming
A tight-fitting garment worn for swimming.
The clothes that one wears when bathing in the sea or a swimming pool, especially the one-piece garment worn by women and girls; a swimming costume, bathing suit, swimming trunks or swimsuit.
The garments that one wears when bathing in the sea or a swimming pool, especially the one-piece garment worn by women and girls.
A tight-fitting garment worn for swimming, especially the one-piece garment worn by women and girls.
Items of clothing appropriate for swimming

bn:00001530n: A woman is a female human.
An animal of the sex that produces eggs.
An adult human member of the sex that produces ova and bears young.
An adult female person (as opposed to a man)

bn:00006125n: Clothing is material used to cover parts of the human body for protection against the environment, for comfort and body modesty, and as personal decoration, often reflecting religious, cultural, and social customs.
Clothing is fiber and textile material worn on the body.
All coverings designed to be worn on a person's body.
Something that can be worn; an item of clothing.
A covering of or like clothing.
An act or instance of putting clothes on.
A covering designed to be worn on a person's body
Fiber and textile material worn on the body

bn:00010363n: A woman's very brief bathing suit

bn:00033731n: Fashion refers to styles of dress that are popular in a culture at any given time.
The latest and most admired style in clothes and cosmetics and behavior
Term for a popular style or practice in clothing, make-up, furniture, etc.
The latest and most admired style in clothes and cosmetics and behavior.
Fashion is a popular style or practice, especially in clothing, footwear, accessories, makeup, body piercing, or furniture.
A prevailing mode of expression, e.g., clothing

bn:00034453n: A young female human; (in contrast to boy), a female child or young adult.
A title of respect for a young woman (usually unmarried) with or without a name used.
A young female person, usually a child or teenager.
A girl is any female human from birth through childhood and adolescence to attainment of adulthood when she becomes a woman.
A girl is a female human from birth through childhood and adolescence to attainment of adulthood when she becomes a woman.

bn:00009263n: A lat, narrow strip of sand, gravel or pebbles along the shoreline of a body of water (ocean, river, lake).
An area of sand sloping down to the water of a sea or lake
A beach is a landform along the coast of an ocean, sea, lake, or river.
The shore of a body of water, especially when sandy or pebbly.
Landform along the shoreline of an ocean, sea, lake, or river

bn:00075579n: The activity of moving oneself through water using one's arms and legs while buoyed up by the water, carried out by humans for amusement, exercise, sport or entertainment.
A race carried out by swimming through water
An act or instance of swimming.
The act of swimming: "they took a short swim in the pool"
Swimming is a water based sport governed by the FÃ©dÃ©ration Internationale de Natation.
